TopicTitle: What other forums do you frequently go on?

Articles.Content:
just askin.....

i am high ranked on the Goldhawk Interactive Forums
None. They all suck compared to these forums.

quite a few actually:

Elite Dangerous: https://forums.frontier.co.uk/forumdisplay.php?f=29

DCS: http://forums.eagle.ru/?langid=1

Star citi: https://forums.robertsspaceindustries.com/

Space Engine: http://en.spaceengine.org/forum

I used to have a fair few, but at the moment it's just this one. Back when modding Spore was popular (or as popular as it ever really was, anyway), I frequented several of those forums, though they've all died and been pulled down now, save for one. I used to frequent the Minecraft forums, dabbled in making texture packs, had a big ol' gift code giveaway thread that never really accomplished its goal (though I did give quite a few people gift codes, but never as many as I'd hoped I'd be able to). Somewhere along the way I dabbled in YYG's GameMaker, and I was around their forums.

Nowadays, there's never enough to interest me... so I just remain here.
The Ksp and SpaceEngine communities are the best I've met in a while, honestly.
Im sometimes in the PCGamesHardware forum. I used to visit the Egosoft forum (i heard about KSP there), but since the fail with X-Rebirth i look there only every few months...

I tend to frequent the forums of games I play, and those podcasts I listen to that have active forums.

So currently I'm on 3 forums (not counting this one):

That Video Game Podcast

FTL

Invisible, Inc.

(while I play Xcom it's old enough and I've not experienced it enough that I'm concerned about having the storyline spoiled for me. So I'm avoiding all non-game content for that game including forums)
Although I haven't been there in a while I was a very active participant in the debate and discussion forums at total war center.
The Ars Technica forum is the only other one I participate in regularly, and not nearly as much as here. I read some other subject-specific ones as needs arise but that's about it.

Probably the forum I'm second most active on is the Space Engine forum. There the community is pretty good and like here the admins have strict rules. Though I really only pop in occasionally to check on the software's development.

Mostly Reddit

Edited March 5, 2020 by Hydrazine_Soup
Some reddit's are nice, but all other forums are a big nope.

I don't really go on any other forums, except for my brother's dead minecraft server's site and his friend's one just to check that things are well (not that much happens but I'm an admin on them ) and, sometimes, Reddit. I used to go on MC forums before and unofficially helped a mod author with community relations but I never go on them anymore. Before that, I used to be quite active on Powder Toy forums until my I got IP banned after my brother trolled the site with my account.

To be honest, this is the best forum I've ever been on. MinecraftForum is complete and utter garbage (just sift through this thread and this thread). Powder Toy forums used to be very good but has recently gotten terrible.
The orbiter forum, the XKCD forums, and sometimes EDF 2.

This is only one I come on twice a day, all others are once a week at best (usually once a month).

Edited February 5, 2015 by LABHOUSE
